entry.summary: TRI CITY — South Umpqua High School held Thanksgiving lunch Friday, inviting over 450 students, staff and administration to partake in the traditionally festive foods.

entry.title: FREE FISHING DAYS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AFTER THANKSGIVING

entry.title: First Annual Umpqua Valley Food Rally Brings in Over $2,000 and More Than a Ton of Food
entry.summary: The first annual Umpqua Valley Food Rally collected 2,176 pounds of food and raised $2,128 to support families across Douglas County. Planned in just three weeks, the event drew strong community turnout and organizers say it will now become an annual tradition.

entry.title: WAID to Host Free Community Christmas Celebration on December 12
entry.summary: WAID will host the 2025 Free Community Christmas on Dec. 12 at the Winston Community Center, featuring Santa, live entertainment, contests, a cake walk, refreshments, and raffle prizes. The event is free for all, with donations still welcomed to support the celebration.

entry.title: 3rd Annual Winston-Dillard Festival Association Christmas Ball Set for Dec. 13
entry.summary: The 3rd Annual Winston-Dillard Festival Association Christmas Ball returns Dec. 13 with live music by Borrowed Time, refreshments by Freed Estate Winery, and a festive evening of dancing at the Winston Community Center. Tickets are on sale now.

entry.title: NOAA Cuts Funding for Alaska Seismic Monitoring, Raising Concerns Over Tsunami Readiness
entry.summary: Funding cuts by NOAA have halted real-time seismic data from the Alaska Earthquake Center, raising concerns about reduced accuracy in tsunami forecasting. Emergency officials warn that the loss of nearby sensors increases uncertainty and could impact coastal evacuation decisions.

entry.title: The FISH of Roseburg Food Pantry holds first The Umpqua Valley Food Rally in Roseburg
entry.summary: Before Barbara Clithero drove away from The Umpqua Valley Food Rally and volunteers sorted through her donated bag of food, she said it was for one reason: Her duty to her community.
